main event: A civilian observed a brilliant cigar-shaped light moving from southeast to northwest in Clayton, Alabama on June 21, 1954.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a shooting star but maintained its brilliance throughout the observation., The object had no discernible features such as a tail, exhaust, or sound., The witness, Claude C. Ventress, described the object as looking like a small amount of reflected light., During the observation, the object made a sharp left turn and then resumed its northwest course., Ventress hesitated to report the incident due to fears of ridicule.
witness description: Claude C. Ventress, a civilian and the outgoing president of the Rotary Club, appeared stable and experienced with aircraft.
